<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 6"
    pfs=""
>
[Slice and Swipe](/Feats.aspx?ID=2206) <actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Agents of Edgewatch</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Flourish" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=73" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Rogue" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=139" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #159: All or Nothing](/Sources.aspx?ID=48) pg. 75</row>

**Access**
Help either the Washboard Dogs or the Diobel Sweepers destroy their rival.

**Requirements**
You're wielding a melee weapon that deals slashing damage and you have a free hand.

</column>

---

You attempt a melee Strike with the required weapon. If you hit and deal damage and the result of your attack roll exceeds the target's Perception DC, you [Steal](/Actions.aspx?ID=68) a small object from the target (as if you had succeeded at that task using the [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=17) skill). Depending on the object, the target might realize that it has been stolen, and onlookers might realize you have stolen the object if the attack roll doesn't exceed their Perception DCs.

<title level="2">Gang Feats</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #159: All or Nothing](/Sources.aspx?ID=48) pg. 75</row>

Street gangs in Absalom recruit amateur pickpockets, ruffians, and vandals who show promise in their specialties and operate well in tight groups.

 Rogue agents can gain access to some of the following rogue feats by successfully helping Maurrisa Jonne or Bloody Berleth eliminate their rival (see Chapter 1). Some of these feats, however, can be gained only by helping a particular side in the gang conflict.

**Related Feats**: [Ambushing Knockdown](/Feats.aspx?ID=2207), [Coordinated Distraction](/Feats.aspx?ID=2210), [Deny Support](/Feats.aspx?ID=2209), [Subtle Shank](/Feats.aspx?ID=2208)
